article: For many _ in the US, earning some money gives them a sense of _ . By making their own money they can buy whatever they want . It also develops a sense of responsibility and independence . Most teens I know have a small sum of money . Their _ give them an allowance . For some ,an allowance is given every week ; for others , every month or so . Usually they can get 10 to 30 dollars a month from their parents . An allowance is typically based on the _ of chores , such as washing the dishes , cleaning up one's room, taking out the trash , and _ the floor . _ to younger siblings is also regarded as worthy of extra cash , _ some cases . Many teens also work to get _ .Since most of my peers are not _ for a formal job , many choose part-time positions . These require  ly _ time and basically no training . They can have these jobs like babysitting ; _ younger students , offered by most schools in return for a small fee ; _ bagging groceries at local supermarkets .  As for spending habits , most teens spend their money in a ly carefree style . Often , a month's allowance can be spent in just a few hours . I'm not saying that teens in US are incapable of saving money . Indeed , in many situations , teens can be quite level-headed in _ money towards college or other _ plans . The way teens manage their money should not be seen as a _ . It may just be a defining characteristic of their carefree _ .
